text: Paul and Timothy, slaves of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace be unto you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you
speaker: Narrator

text: always in every prayer of mine for you all, making request with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now,
speaker: Narrator

text: being confident of this very thing, that he who has begun a good work in you will perfect it until the day of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as it is right for me to think this of you all because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are joint partakers of my grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this I pray that your charity may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all perception,
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye may approve the best, that ye may be sincere and without offense until the day of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: being filled with fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace and in all other places;
speaker: Narrator

text: and many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some indeed preach the Christ even out of envy and strife, but others also out of good will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some preach the Christ out of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add tribulation to my bonds,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the others out of charity, knowing that I am placed here for the defense of the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretense, or in truth, Christ is preached, and I therein do rejoice, and will even rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that this shall become my saving health through your prayer and the nourishment of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to me to live is Christ and to die is gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labour, yet I do not know what to choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am in a strait between the two, having a desire to depart and to be with Christ, which is far better:
speaker: Narrator

text: nevertheless, to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: that your glorying in Jesus Christ may be more abundant by my coming to you again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only let your conversation be as is worthy of the gospel of Christ, that whether I come and see you or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, unanimous, working together for the faith of the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in nothing terrified by your adversaries, which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of saving health and that of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto you it is granted regarding Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake,
speaker: Narrator

text: having the same conflict which ye saw in me and now hear to be in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if there is any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of charity, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,
speaker: Narrator

text: fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same charity, unanimous, minding the one thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory, but in humility let each esteem others better than themselves,
speaker: Narrator

text: with each one not looking to their own things, but also to the things of others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God,
speaker: Narrator

text: but emptied himself, taking the form of a slave, made in the likeness of men,
speaker: Narrator

text: and being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross. {Gr. stauros – stake}
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, God also has highly exalted him and given him a name which is above every name,
speaker: Narrator

text: that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven and things in earth and things under the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that every tongue should confess that the Lord Jesus Christ is Lord in the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my beloved, as ye have always hearkened, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own saving health with fear and trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is God who works in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do all things without murmurings and doubts,
speaker: Narrator

text: that ye may be blameless and innocent, children of God without rebuke in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding fast the word of life, that I may glory in the day of Christ that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And even if I am poured out as an offering upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy and rejoice with you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the same cause ye also have joy and rejoice with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort when I know your state.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have no one likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye know the proof of him, that as a son with the father, he has served with me in the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I hope to send him presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and companion in labour and fellowsoldier, but your messenger and he that ministered to my needs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he longed after you all and was full of heaviness, because ye had heard that he had been sick
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed he was sick near unto death, but God had mercy on him and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent him, therefore, the more carefully, that when ye see him again, ye may rejoice and that I may be the less sorrowful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness and esteem such
speaker: Narrator

text: because for the work of the Christ he was near unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.
speaker: Narrator

text: It remains, my brethren, that ye rejoice in the Lord. It does not bother me to write the same things to you, and for you it is safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware of dogs, beware of evil workers, beware of the concision.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are the circumcision, who serve God in spirit and glory in Christ Jesus, having no confidence in the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I might also have reason to confide in the flesh. If any other man thinks that he has whereof he might trust in the flesh, I more:
speaker: Narrator

text: Circumcised the eighth day, of the lineage of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; concerning the law, a Pharisee;
speaker: Narrator

text: concerning zeal, a persecutor of the congregation; {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} concerning the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those things which were gain to me, I counted loss for Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And doubtless I even count all things as loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things and do count them but dung, that I may win Christ
speaker: Narrator

text: and be found in him, not having my own righteousness, which is of the law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, the righteousness which is of God by faith:
speaker: Narrator

text: That I may know him and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of his sufferings, being made conformable unto his death,
speaker: Narrator

text: if by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not as though I had already attained it, either were already perfect, but I follow after, if I may lay hold of that for which I have also been laid hold of by the Christ, Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, I do not reckon to have laid hold of it yet, but this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind and extending myself unto those things which are ahead,
speaker: Narrator

text: I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us, therefore, as many as are perfect, be thus minded; and if in anything ye are otherwise minded, God shall reveal even this unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, in that unto which we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us have the same mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, be imitators of me and consider those who so walk, as ye have us for a pattern.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For many walk, of whom I have told you often and now tell you even weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross {Gr. stauros – stake} of Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: whose end shall be perdition, whose God is their belly and whose glory is in their shame, who mind earthly things).
speaker: Narrator

text: For our citizenship is in heaven, from where we also look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall transform our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto the body of his glory, according to the working by which he is also able to subdue all things unto himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beseech Euodias and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women who laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also and with my other fellowlabourers, whose names are in the book of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord always, and again I say, Rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be anxious for nothing, but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peace of God, which passes all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brethren, whatever things are true, whatever things are honest, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report, if there is any virtue and if there is any praise, exercise yourselves in these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those things, which ye have both learned and received and heard and seen in me, do, and the God of peace shall be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care of me has flourished again, in which ye were also concerned, but ye lacked opportunity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I speak in respect of want, for I have learned, in whatever state I am, to be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know both how to be humbled, and I know how to have an abundance; in everything and by all things I am instructed, both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.
speaker: Narrator

text: I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding ye have done well, that ye did communicate with my tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now ye Philippians know also that in the beginning of the gospel when I departed from Macedonia, no congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not because I desire a gift, but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have all and abound; I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren who are with me greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the saints greet you, chiefly those that are of the Caesar’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
